multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing decreasing vision and seeing black spots in my right eye for the past two days.
Have you had any pain or redness in the affected eye?
No, I have no pain in the affected eye.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past, or is this the first occurrence?
This is the first occurrence of these symptoms.
Do you have any other medical issues or are you currently on any medication?

Yes, I have AIDS and was diagnosed with Kaposi's sarcoma two years ago. I am currently on several medications including efavirenz, tenofovir, emtricitabine, azithromycin, trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole, multivitamins, and a nutritional supplement.
Do you have a history of recent changes in your immune status or any recent infections?
I was treated for fungal esophagitis 6 months ago, and my CD4+ T-lymphocyte count is currently 76 per cubic millimeter.
Final Diagnosis: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis
